oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robert H. Cartmell Diaries Excerpts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpts from the Robert H. Cartmell Diaries. They contain full commentaries on the nature of his farm operation, the weather, and the fluctuations of the cotton market. They contain thoughtful comments on politics and candidates for office and opinions on matters of public interest, such as the price of cotton, slavery, abolition, railroads, agricultural meetings, state fairs, prohibition, religion, secession, the Union, and conditions in Madison County .
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cartmell, Robert H., 1828-1915
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil War in the West; Civil War society; United States - History - 1783-1865; United States - History - 1849-1877; United States History - Civil War, 1861-1865
Civil Wars; War; Slaves; Agriculture; Political issues; Cities & towns
